Operation 'GetExportRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, not_actionable, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Export Recipients Status' is vague and doesn't indicate the full scope of the operation (retrieving both status and download URLs). Description is verbose and mixes procedural guidance with operational details. Improved summary is action-oriented and concise. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) what the operation does (retrieves status and results), (2) required inputs (export job ID), (3) expected outputs (status, completion state, URLs), (4) how to use the results (download via URLs), and (5) use case context. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint can be used to check the status of a recipient export job**. 

To use this call, you will need the `id` from the "Export Recipients" call.

If you would like to download a list, take the `id` that is returned from the "Export Recipients" endpoint and make an API request here to get the `urls`. Once you have the list of URLs, make a `GET` request on each URL to download your CSV file(s).

Twilio SendGrid recommends exporting your recipients regularly as a backup to avoid issues or lost data.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve recipient export job status and download URLs
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves the status and results of a recipient export job. Requires the export job ID returned from the "Export Recipients" endpoint. Returns the export job status, completion state, and download URLs for the exported CSV file(s). Once the export job completes, use the returned URLs to download the recipient data. This operation is useful for monitoring long-running export operations and retrieving exported contact lists.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Export Recipients Status' is vague and doesn't indicate the full scope of the operation (retrieving both status and download URLs). Description is verbose and mixes procedural guidance with operational details. Improved summary is action-oriented and concise. Enhanced description clarifies: (1) what the operation does (retrieves status and results), (2) required inputs (export job ID), (3) expected outputs (status, completion state, URLs), (4) how to use the results (download via URLs), and (5) use case context. This helps AI agents understand when to invoke this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'CreateCustomField' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too brief and lacks critical details. Missing information about required inputs (field name, type), what the response contains (ID, timestamp), and the purpose/benefit of custom fields. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a custom field.**

**You can create up to 120 custom fields.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new custom field for your contacts. You can create up to 120 custom fields per account. Requires a field name and type in the request body. Returns the created custom field object with its ID, name, type, and creation timestamp. Custom fields enable you to store additional contact attributes beyond standard fields.
data.reasoning: Description is too brief and lacks critical details. Missing information about required inputs (field name, type), what the response contains (ID, timestamp), and the purpose/benefit of custom fields. Added context about the 120-field limit and what data is returned to help AI agents understand the operation's full scope.

message: Operation 'ListCustomField' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details. Description lacks specificity about response structure and use cases. Added details about the array response format, field properties returned, empty array behavior, and practical use case guidance for AI agents to understand when to call this operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all custom fields.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all custom fields defined for your account. Returns an array of custom field objects, each containing the field ID, name, type, and creation timestamp. If no custom fields have been created, an empty array is returned. Use this operation to discover available custom fields before adding or updating contact data.
data.reasoning: Description lacks specificity about response structure and use cases. Added details about the array response format, field properties returned, empty array behavior, and practical use case guidance for AI agents to understand when to call this operation.

message: Operation 'GetCustomField' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description is too minimal. Added clarity about the required custom_field_id parameter, what properties are returned in the response, and practical context for when an AI agent would use this operation versus the list operation.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a custom field by ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific custom field by its ID. Requires the custom_field_id path parameter. Returns the custom field object containing the field ID, name, type, and creation timestamp. Use this operation to get detailed information about a specific custom field before using it in contact operations.
data.reasoning: Description is too minimal. Added clarity about the required custom_field_id parameter, what properties are returned in the response, and practical context for when an AI agent would use this operation versus the list operation.

message: Operation 'DeleteCustomField' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_side_effects. data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a custom field by ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a custom field by its ID. Requires the custom_field_id path parameter. Returns a 202 Accepted response. Deleting a custom field removes it from your account and any associated data stored in that field for existing contacts will be lost. This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Description lacks critical information about side effects and destructive nature of the operation. Added details about the required parameter, response code, and important warning about data loss to help AI agents understand the consequences before executing this operation.

message: Operation 'CreateContactDbList' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Description is too generic and lacks specificity. Added details about required inputs (list name), response structure (ID, name, recipient count, timestamp), and context about the purpose of lists in the Legacy Marketing Campaigns system to improve AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to create a list for your recipients.**
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new recipient list for organizing and managing your marketing contacts. Requires a list name in the request body. Returns the created list object with its ID, name, recipient count (initially 0), creation timestamp, and metadata. Lists are used to segment and organize contacts for targeted campaigns.
data.reasoning: Description is too generic and lacks specificity. Added details about required inputs (list name), response structure (ID, name, recipient count, timestamp), and context about the purpose of lists in the Legacy Marketing Campaigns system to improve AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete multiple recipient lists.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes multiple recipient lists by their IDs. Requires an array of list IDs in the request body. Returns a 202 Accepted response. Deleting lists removes them from your account and all associated recipient data within those lists will be permanently deleted. This action cannot be undone. Use with caution.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single recipient list.**

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to update the name of one of your recipient lists.**
data.description_suggestion: Updates the name of a recipient list identified by its ID. Accepts a request body with the new list name. Returns the updated list object with the new name and metadata. Only the list name can be modified through this operation.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description is too narrow and lacks input/output details. Enhanced version clarifies what fields can be updated, what the request body should contain, and what is returned, improving AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a specific recipient list with the given ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a recipient list by its ID. This operation permanently removes the list and all its associations. Returns a 202 Accepted response indicating the deletion has been queued for processing. Note: This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear, but description lacks important side effect information about permanent deletion and the asynchronous nature (202 response). Enhanced version clarifies the destructive nature and irreversibility for AI agent safety and proper usage.

data.current_summary: Retrieve all recipients on a List
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to retrieve all recipients on the list with the given ID.**
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all recipients associated with a specific list by list ID. Supports pagination through limit and offset parameters. Returns a paginated collection of recipient objects containing email addresses and custom field values. Use pagination parameters to control result set size and navigate through large recipient lists.
data.reasoning: Summary is adequate, but description lacks critical details about pagination support and response structure. Enhanced version clarifies pagination parameters and response format, essential for AI agents to properly iterate through results.

message: Operation 'AddRecipientsToContactDbList' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Summary is clear and actionable. Description has good input details but lacks clarity on output and the important side effect that this links existing recipients rather than creating new ones. data.current_summary: Add Multiple Recipients to a List
data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to add multiple recipients to a list.**

Adds existing recipients to a list, passing in the recipient IDs to add. Recipient IDs (base64-encoded email addresses) should be passed exactly as they are returned from recipient endpoints.
data.description_suggestion: Adds multiple existing recipients to a list by their recipient IDs. Requires a request body containing an array of recipient IDs (base64-encoded email addresses). Recipient IDs must be passed exactly as returned from recipient endpoints. Returns a 201 Created response. This operation links existing recipients to the list without creating new recipients.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and actionable. Description has good input details but lacks clarity on output and the important side effect that this links existing recipients rather than creating new ones. Enhanced version clarifies the linking behavior and response code for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Add a Single Recipient to a List
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to add a single recipient to a list.**
data.description_suggestion: Adds a single existing recipient to a list by recipient ID. Requires the list ID and recipient ID (base64-encoded email address) as path parameters. Returns a 201 Created response. This operation links an existing recipient to the list without creating a new recipient. The recipient must already exist in the contact database.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear, but description is minimal and lacks essential details about path parameters, response code, and the requirement that the recipient must already exist. Enhanced version clarifies these prerequisites and the linking behavior for proper AI agent usage.

data.current_summary: Delete a Single Recipient from a Single List
data.current_description: **This endpoint allows you to delete a single recipient from a list.**
data.description_suggestion: Removes a single recipient from a list by list ID and recipient ID. Requires both the list ID and recipient ID (base64-encoded email address) as path parameters. Returns a 202 Accepted response. This operation only removes the recipient from the specified list; the recipient remains in the contact database and may be on other lists.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear but verbose. Description lacks critical details about path parameters, response code, and the important side effect that deletion is list-specific, not global. data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to delete a segment from your recipients database.**

You also have the option to delete all the contacts from your Marketing Campaigns recipient database who were in this segment.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes a segment from your Marketing Campaigns contacts database. Optionally removes all contacts that were members of the deleted segment using the `delete_contacts` parameter. Returns a success response. The segment definition is permanently removed; contacts can be optionally purged based on the parameter setting.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to add a Marketing Campaigns recipient.**

You can add custom field data as a parameter on this endpoint. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.

The rate limit is three requests every 2 seconds. You can upload 1000  contacts per request. So the maximum upload rate is 1500 recipients per second.
data.summary_suggestion: Add one or more recipients to contact database
data.description_suggestion: Adds one or more recipients to your Marketing Campaigns contact database. Accepts an array of recipient objects with email addresses and optional custom field data. Supports up to 1000 contacts per request with a rate limit of 3 requests per 2 seconds (maximum 1500 recipients/second). Returns a 201 response with details of created recipients. Custom fields can be included in recipient objects using SendGrid's default or custom field definitions.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Add recipients' is too generic. Description lacks clarity about array input requirement, return value, and side effects (contacts added to database). data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to update one or more recipients.**

The body of an API call to this endpoint must include an array of one or more recipient objects.

It is of note that you can add custom field data as parameters on recipient objects. We have provided an example using some of the default custom fields SendGrid provides.
data.summary_suggestion: Update one or more recipient records
data.description_suggestion: Updates one or more existing recipients in your contact database. Requires an array of recipient objects with IDs and fields to update. Supports partial updates - only provided fields will be modified. Custom field data can be included in recipient objects. Returns a 201 response confirming the update. Existing recipient data not included in the request remains unchanged.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

Batch deletion of a page makes it possible to receive an empty page of recipients before reaching the end of
the list of recipients. To avoid this issue; iterate over pages until a 404 is retrieved.
data.summary_suggestion: List all recipients with pagination support
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a paginated list of all recipients in your contact database. Supports pagination parameters to control page size and offset. Returns a 200 response containing an array of recipient objects with their contact information and custom field data. Note: Batch deletions may result in empty pages during iteration; continue paginating until a 404 response is received to ensure all recipients are retrieved.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks pagination context. Description missing input parameters (pagination controls), output details (array of recipients), and unclear about response structure. Added pagination parameter context, clarified return format, and improved explanation of the edge case behavior for better AI agent understanding of how to use pagination and handle responses.

message: Operation 'ListSearchRecipient' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary 'Search recipients' is too generic. Description is poorly structured with unclear formatting. Added clarity about parameter requirements, field type handling, automatic date range expansion, return value, and distinction from POST search endpoint. Improved formatting and organization for better AI agent understanding of when to use this GET vs POST variant.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to perform a search on all of your Marketing Campaigns recipients.**

field_name:

* is a variable that is substituted for your actual custom field name from your recipient.
* Text fields must be url-encoded. Date fields are searchable only by unix timestamp (e.g. 2/2/2015 becomes 1422835200)
* If field_name is a 'reserved' date field, such as created_at or updated_at, the system will internally convert
your epoch time to a date range encompassing the entire day. For example, an epoch time of 1422835600 converts to
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:06:40 GMT, but internally the system will search from Mon, 02 Feb 2015 00:00:00 GMT through
Mon, 02 Feb 2015 23:59:59 GMT.
data.summary_suggestion: Search recipients by field query parameters
data.description_suggestion: Searches Marketing Campaigns recipients using query parameters. Accepts a field_name parameter (custom or reserved field) and a search value. Text fields must be URL-encoded; date fields use unix timestamps. Reserved date fields (created_at, updated_at) automatically expand timestamps to encompass the entire day. Returns a list of matching recipient objects. This is a simpler alternative to the POST search endpoint for basic single-field queries.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Search recipients' is too generic. Description is poorly structured with unclear formatting. Added clarity about parameter requirements, field type handling, automatic date range expansion, return value, and distinction from POST search endpoint. Improved formatting and organization for better AI agent understanding of when to use this GET vs POST variant.

data.current_description:
Search using segment conditions without actually creating a segment.
Body contains a JSON object with `conditions`, a list of conditions as described below, and an optional `list_id`, which is a valid list ID for a list to limit the search on.

Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

- Dates:
  - `"eq"`, `"ne"`, `"lt"` (before), `"gt"` (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
  - `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
  - `"is within"`
    - You may use an [ISO 8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) date format or the # of days.
- Text: `"contains"`, `"eq"` (is - matches the full field), `"ne"` (is not - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value), `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Numbers: `"eq"`, `"lt"`, `"gt"`, `"empty"`, `"not_empty"`
- Email Clicks and Opens: `"eq"` (opened), `"ne"` (not opened)

Field values must all be a string.

Search conditions using `"eq"` or `"ne"` for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.

The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.

Search conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an `"and"` or `"or"` in the `"and_or"` field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty `"and_or"`, and subsequent conditions must all specify an `"and_or"`.
data.summary_suggestion: Search recipients using advanced segment conditions
data.description_suggestion: Searches Marketing Campaigns recipients using advanced segment conditions without creating a segment. Accepts a JSON body with a `conditions` array (required) and optional `list_id` to scope search to a specific list. Conditions support multiple field types (dates, text, numbers, email engagement) with type-specific operators (eq, ne, lt, gt, contains, empty, not_empty, is within). Multiple conditions can be combined with AND/OR logic. Returns a list of matching recipient objects. Use this for complex multi-field searches; use GET /search for simple single-field queries.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't distinguish this POST endpoint from the GET variant. Description is comprehensive but poorly organized and lacks return value information and use case guidance. Reorganized for clarity, added return value details, and included guidance on when to use this endpoint vs the GET variant for better AI agent decision-making.

Improved AI agent interpretability for understanding when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to create a new segment.**


  Valid operators for create and update depend on the type of the field for which you are searching.

**Dates**
- "eq", "ne", "lt" (before), "gt" (after)
    - You may use MM/DD/YYYY for day granularity or an epoch for second granularity.
- "empty", "not_empty"
- "is within"
    - You may use an [ISO 8601 date format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) or the # of days.

**Text**
- "contains"
- "eq" (is/equals - matches the full field)
- "ne" (is not/not equals - matches any field where the entire field is not the condition value)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Numbers**
- "eq" (is/equals)
- "lt" (is less than)
- "gt" (is greater than)
- "empty"
- "not_empty"

**Email Clicks and Opens**
- "eq" (opened)
- "ne" (not opened)

All field values must be a string.


Conditions using "eq" or "ne" for email clicks and opens should provide a "field" of either `clicks.campaign_identifier` or `opens.campaign_identifier`.
The condition value should be a string containing the id of a completed campaign.


The conditions list may contain multiple conditions, joined by an "and" or "or" in the "and_or" field.

The first condition in the conditions list must have an empty `"and_or"`, and subsequent conditions must all specify an `"and_or"`.
data.summary_suggestion: Create a new recipient segment with conditions
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new segment in Marketing Campaigns based on recipient conditions. Requires a JSON body with segment name, conditions array, and optional list_id to scope the segment to a specific list. Conditions support multiple field types (dates, text, numbers, email engagement) with type-specific operators. Multiple conditions can be combined with AND/OR logic. Returns the created segment object with segment ID, name, recipient count, and condition details. The segment is immediately available for use in campaigns and can be updated or deleted later.
data.reasoning: Original summary lacks specificity about what defines a segment (conditions). Description is overly technical and lacks essential information about required inputs, return value, and side effects (segment creation and availability). Reorganized to clarify inputs (name, conditions, optional list_id), return value (segment object with ID and count), and side effects (segment becomes available for campaigns). Improved AI agent interpretability for understanding when and how to use this operation.
